title: Super Bowl 2025: Chiefs vs. Eagles score, live updates and highlights
description: The Chiefs are looking for a three-peat, while the Eagles want to dethrone the champs.
author: Yahoo Sports
excerpt: The Chiefs are looking for a three-peat, while the Eagles want to dethrone the champs.
text: Super Bowl LIX is finally here, and two of the preseason favorites to get to the end of the line — the two-time defending champion Kansas City Chiefs (15-2) and perennial NFC power Philadelphia Eagles (14-3) — have made it to New Orleans to meet for a chance to win the Lombardi Trophy. For Philadelphia, a win would be a second Super Bowl title in franchise history, with the other coming in a Super Bowl LII win over the then-Tom Brady-led Patriots. The Chiefs are looking to ascend to rare air with an unprecedented third-straight Super Bowl victory. Only the 1965-67 Green Bay Packers (an NFL title in 1965 to go along with winning the first two Super Bowls) have won three consecutive championships in the 105-season history of the NFL.Patrick Mahomes and Jalen Hurts led their teams to this same game two years ago. The Chiefs beat the Eagles in Super Bowl LVII in a 38-35 thriller. Harrison Butker hit a game-winning field goal with eight seconds to play to break a 35-all tie. He has 29 yards on 11 carries.Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:52 p.m. MSTEagles force ANOTHER 3-and-outAnd the Philly defense collects another sack of Patrick Mahomes in the process. Just under five minutes to play in the second quarter, and the Eagles have been in control of the game since the opening kickoff.Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:49 p.m. MSTChiefs in a tough spot, down 17 pointsTwenty-seven Super Bowls have featured a team with a 17+ point lead. Those teams ... have not had a good record coming back from those deficits.Teams that trail by 17+ points in a Super Bowl are 1-26— Jay Morrison (@ByJayMorrison) February 10, 2025Tom Brady is in the building, though, so ...Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:44 p.m. MSTBack-to-back sacks and a pick six for the Eagles!What a turn of events for the Eagles, who sacked Patrick Mahomes twice before the QB threw a pick-six to birthday boy Cooper DeJean. The Eagles are going at All-Pro corner Trent McDuffie tonight.Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:32 p.m. MSTEagles take over with good field positionPhilly survives the Hurts interception, as the Chiefs couldn't get off their own goal line. K.C. still has just one first down and has run just 10 offensive plays. The Eagles take over at their own 43 after the puntSun, February 9, 2025 at 5:29 p.m. MSTChiefs can't take advantagePatrick Mahomes couldn't connect with Travis Kelce on 3rd down and the Eagles defense forces another three-and-out.Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:24 p.m. MSTBryan Cook interception!The Chiefs will take over deep in Eagles territory after Jalen Hurts threw his first interception since Week 10 against the Cowboys.Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:23 p.m. MSTEnd of 1st quarter: Eagles 7, Chiefs 0Penalties have been one of the big stories of the early going, with the Eagles getting a couple of 3rd-down conversions via penalty, and a penalty negating a 4th-down conversion for Philly. html:
Super Bowl LIX is finally here, and two of the preseason favorites to get to the end of the line — the two-time defending champion Kansas City Chiefs (15-2) and perennial NFC power Philadelphia Eagles (14-3) — have made it to New Orleans to meet for a chance to win the Lombardi Trophy. For Philadelphia, a win would be a second Super Bowl title in franchise history, with the other coming in a Super Bowl LII win over the then-Tom Brady-led Patriots. The Chiefs are looking to ascend to rare air with an unprecedented third-straight Super Bowl victory. Only the 1965-67 Green Bay Packers (an NFL title in 1965 to go along with winning the first two Super Bowls) have won three consecutive championships in the 105-season history of the NFL.

Patrick Mahomes and Jalen Hurts led their teams to this same game two years ago. The Chiefs beat the Eagles in Super Bowl LVII in a 38-35 thriller. Harrison Butker hit a game-winning field goal with eight seconds to play to break a 35-all tie. Jalen Hurts threw for 304 yards and a score and also rushed for Super Bowl quarterback records of 70 yards and three touchdowns that night.

Follow along with Yahoo Sports for all the game updates, highlights, top moments and more from New Orleans as the Eagles and Chiefs face off for the Lombardi Trophy.

Live71 updates

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 6:07 p.m. MST

    Patrick Mahomes intercepted again!

    The Chiefs QB throws his second interception of the game, this time to Zack Baun as the minutes tick down in the first half.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 6:03 p.m. MST

    Safe to say it's been a rough first half for the Chiefs

    Per ESPN Research: The Chiefs had 11 yards on their first play from scrimmage and have amassed 3 net yards in their next 15 plays combined.

    — Katherine Terrell (@Kat_Terrell) February 10, 2025

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:59 p.m. MST

    Chiefs get a stop under the 2-minute warning

    Jalen Hurts couldn't connect with A.J. Brown on the 3rd down play against the blitz, and the Eagles will punt with 1:56 to play in the 2nd quarter.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:57 p.m. MST

    Eagles open drive with longest Barkley run of the game

    It was just a 9-yard gain, but these are the kinds of cumulative body blows that the Eagles have landed in games where Saquon has ripped off some home-run balls later in games. He has 29 yards on 11 carries.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:52 p.m. MST

    Eagles force ANOTHER 3-and-out

    And the Philly defense collects another sack of Patrick Mahomes in the process. Just under five minutes to play in the second quarter, and the Eagles have been in control of the game since the opening kickoff.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:49 p.m. MST

    Chiefs in a tough spot, down 17 points

    Twenty-seven Super Bowls have featured a team with a 17+ point lead. Those teams ... have not had a good record coming back from those deficits.

    Teams that trail by 17+ points in a Super Bowl are 1-26

    — Jay Morrison (@ByJayMorrison) February 10, 2025

    Tom Brady is in the building, though, so ...

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:44 p.m. MST

    Back-to-back sacks and a pick six for the Eagles!

    What a turn of events for the Eagles, who sacked Patrick Mahomes twice before the QB threw a pick-six to birthday boy Cooper DeJean. Eagles up 17-0 with seven minutes left in the second quarter.

    Read more here.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:40 p.m. MST

    Jake Elliott knocks through a 48-yard field goal to make it a 10-0 game

    After an attempt to draw the Chiefs offsides and a false start penalty made for an adventure on 4th down, the Eagles took a two-score lead with just over eight minutes left in the first half.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:35 p.m. MST

    Philly with another 3rd-down conversion

    Hurts to A.J. Brown, dropping it in the back-shoulder bucket. The Eagles are going at All-Pro corner Trent McDuffie tonight.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:32 p.m. MST

    Eagles take over with good field position

    Philly survives the Hurts interception, as the Chiefs couldn't get off their own goal line. K.C. still has just one first down and has run just 10 offensive plays. The Eagles take over at their own 43 after the punt

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:29 p.m. MST

    Chiefs can't take advantage

    Patrick Mahomes couldn't connect with Travis Kelce on 3rd down and the Eagles defense forces another three-and-out.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:24 p.m. MST

    Bryan Cook interception!

    The Chiefs will take over deep in Eagles territory after Jalen Hurts threw his first interception since Week 10 against the Cowboys.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:23 p.m. MST

    End of 1st quarter: Eagles 7, Chiefs 0

    Penalties have been one of the big stories of the early going, with the Eagles getting a couple of 3rd-down conversions via penalty, and a penalty negating a 4th-down conversion for Philly. The other story has been the Eagles' ability to move the ball. They out-gained K.C. 115 to 19 in the first quarter and Patrick Mahomes and company have just one first down.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:20 p.m. MST

    Eagles pick up another 3rd down conversion via penalty

    This time Charles Omenihu lined up offsides on a play where Jalen Hurts was sacked, and now the Eagles have it inside the Chiefs' 30 with a fresh set of downs.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:17 p.m. MST

    Hurts to Smith on a 3rd down to move the chains

    Philadelphia has first downs on all three drives now, and Jalen Hurts has had all kinds of time in the pocket all game.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:13 p.m. MST

    Eagles to take over at their own 20 after a Chiefs punt

    Kansas City went three-and-out on its second drive of the game, and now Philly will have it for a third time. The Eagles moved it well on that second series, and have been moving it a little better than the Chiefs in the early going. Each team has had two series the Eagles have five first downs and 74 total yards to just one first down and 19 yards of offense for the Chiefs.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:11 p.m. MST

    It's a quick three-and-out for the Chiefs, who can't evade Eagles' pressure

    The Eagles seem to have the momentum early, and they'll take over after a Chiefs punt into the end zone.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:07 p.m. MST

    Eagles touchdown on a Tush Push! Philly 7, Chiefs 0

    Or "Brotherly Shove," whichever way you want to say it, it's the fourth career Super Bowl rushing touchdown for Jalen Hurts, who had three of them in Super Bowl 57.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:03 p.m. MST

    Hurts to Dotson for a big Eagles play

    Jalen Hurts hits Jahan Dotson for a huge completion. It was called a touchdown on the field, but is under review.

  • Sun, February 9, 2025 at 5:02 p.m. MST

    Eagles pick up 1st down via penalty

    Trent McDuffie was flagged for a hit to a defenseless receiver, Dallas Goedert, on this play. First down Eagles on the second questionable flag of the game. McDuffie drew the earlier 4th down flag on A.J. Brown.
